title: GROW lettuce at home | How to grow lettuce at home

subtasks: Cut the lettuce head to leave约5 centimeters of the stem
Prepare toothpicks to hold the lettuce stem submerged in water
Fill a container (e.g., jar or Tupperware) with water
Submerge the lettuce stem in water using toothpicks to keep it floating, ensuring it touches the water
Place the container in a sunny location to provide ample sunlight for growth
Change the water every 1-2 days to maintain cleanliness
Monitor the lettuce's growth and harvest when leaves are large and green (around 3 weeks)
If desired, transplant the lettuce into soil for further growth, ensuring proper hole depth and soil compression
Water the transplanted lettuce to keep the soil moist
Gather ingredients including a lime, olive oil, veggie broth, and pepper
Mix the juice with olive oil, veggie broth, and pepper in a container
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed
Store or serve the dressing immediately
